summary: The Infertility Treatment Affordability Act of 2025 proposes an income tax credit for costs associated with infertility treatments. The bill allows eligible individuals to claim a credit equal to 50% of qualified infertility treatment expenses. Limitations apply, including dollar and income restrictions. A portion of the credit is refundable, with adjustments for inflation. The bill defines qualified expenses, eligible individuals, and includes conforming amendments to the Internal Revenue Code. The effective date for the amendments is taxable years beginning after December 31, 2024.
